data.title: Our Original Supporters
data.text:
The USS Missouri Memorial Association’s Original Supporters have made generous donations toward the support of specific fundraising campaigns since the Missouri was brought to Hawaii in June 1998. We extend our sincere thanks for their support in ensuring our success over the years!

Battleship Missouri Memorial Golden Rivet Circle

The Missouri’s hull is held together by thousands of rivets. No one rivet is more important than the rest, and each piece plays its part in holding the ship together. Like rivets, donor contributions are an essential component to the success of the Battleship Missouri Memorial

Thank you to the Golden Riveters' who donated $500 or more during the memorial’s 10th anniversary year and to the massive dry dock endeavor!

Battleship Missouri Memorial Plank Owner

Historically, a Plank Owner was an individual who served as one of the original crew members that commissioned or re-commissioned a ship.

Before the battleship was opened to the public, the USS Missouri Memorial Association began inviting those with a true love of American naval history to become a Plank Owner of the Battleship Missouri Memorial. Companies and Individuals who gave a contribution of $500 or more through 1999 received the honor of Battleship Missouri Memorial Plank Owner.

Many of the areas opened to visitors today were made possible by the generous contributions of the Battleship Missouri Memorial Plank Owner Capital Campaign.
